annotations.title: Dismissal of Permit Requirements
annotations.description: The applicant's statement raises questions about their understanding of county permit requirements.

annotations.title: Undefined Scope of Operations
annotations.description: The phrase 'any and all other outdoor recreational purpose' creates an essentially unlimited permit scope with no enforceable boundaries. Without defining what activities are included or excluded, the county cannot regulate or monitor compliance. This open-ended language could encompass anything from ATV racing to outdoor concerts, making it impossible to assess impacts or establish operating conditions. Conditional use permits require specific, limited usesâ€”not blank checks for undefined future activities.

annotations.title: Measurement Discrepancy
annotations.description: This apparent discrepancy suggests all measurements should be professionally verified.

imageIcons.caption: Measured distance: 524 yards to nearest residence

annotations.title: Backstop Height Inconsistency
annotations.description: Photographs appear to raise questions about lane discipline and containment measures. The application should address how shooting activities are confined to designated areas.

imageIcons.caption: Visual evidence suggests backstop height is significantly less than claimed.

annotations.title: Incomplete Backstop Description
annotations.description: Photographs appear to show exposed rock formations within the impact area. The application could benefit from clarifying the extent of tire coverage.

imageIcons.alt: Photo showing exposed rocks in the backstop area
imageIcons.caption: Site photos reveal natural terrain with exposed rock surfaces.

annotations.title: Ammunition Type Enforcement Gap
annotations.description: While steel core and tracer rounds are prohibited, the application provides no inspection or verification procedures for customer ammunition. Without round-by-round inspection, customers could unknowingly or accidentally load prohibited ammunition types. A single tracer or steel core round striking rocks could ignite the surrounding high-risk fire zone.

annotations.title: Fire Suppression Capabilities
annotations.description: The site is located in an area with extreme wildfire risk (98th percentile). Industry standards typically require pressurized water systems for ranges in high-risk zones. No expert assessment supporting the absence of such systems has been provided.

imageIcons.alt: Wildfire risk map showing extreme danger level
imageIcons.caption: Site location: 98th percentile wildfire risk zone

annotations.title: Environmental Remediation Plan Absent
annotations.description: The application lacks a lead management plan despite EPA requirements for shooting ranges. With Currant Creek traversing the property, groundwater contamination risk assessment and mitigation strategies should be addressed.

annotations.title: Wildlife Impact Assessment Missing
annotations.description: The Boise Foothills support several sensitive species including burrowing owls and Townsends big-eared bats. No biological survey or noise impact study on these species has been provided, as typically required for habitat disruption.

annotations.title: Acoustic Analysis Not Provided
annotations.description: Claims about natural sound mitigation lack supporting acoustic modeling. Professional sound studies typically accompany range applications to quantify impacts on surrounding properties and recreational areas.

annotations.title: Traffic, Emergency Access, Evacuation
annotations.description: While claiming 'no landscaping required,' the application ignores critical access infrastructure needs. No emergency vehicle turnaround areas, evacuation routes, or incident command staging areas are designated. The single access road through residential areas could become blocked, trapping visitors during emergencies. Fire apparatus requires specific road widths and grades not addressed. Mass casualty or wildfire evacuation protocols are essential for remote commercial facilities.

annotations.title: No Parking / Traffic Plan
annotations.description: The application lacks any parking area designation, traffic flow planning, or discussion of access road capacity. Commercial facilities require adequate parking and emergency vehicle turnaround areas. Without infrastructure planning, vehicles may block emergency access or damage surrounding terrain.

annotations.title: Water Runoff and Erosion Control
annotations.description: The application dismisses hydrology concerns without providing drainage plans or erosion control measures. Range operations typically compact soil and concentrate runoff, requiring engineered stormwater management to prevent downstream impacts.

annotations.title: Projectile Containment Failures Documented
annotations.description: Available photographs suggest the backstop dimensions may require professional verification to confirm the stated 100-foot height.

imageIcons.alt: Photo showing exposed rocks in the backstop area
imageIcons.caption: Site photos reveal natural terrain with exposed rock surfaces.

annotations.title: Technical Specifications Lacking
annotations.description: The repeated claim of '100 foot backstops' requires engineering documentation. Visual evidence suggests significantly smaller berms. Professional range design typically includes certified height measurements and construction specifications.

imageIcons.caption: Visual scale suggests backstop dimensions require professional verification

annotations.title: No Measurable Standards of Operations
annotations.description: The repeated use of 'generally,' 'may be,' and 'though' throughout the hours section creates no enforceable limits. A conditional use permit requires specific, binding operational parameters, not suggestions. Terms like 'generally less than 3 hours' and 'generally limited' provide no measurable standards for compliance or enforcement.

annotations.title: Usage Claims
annotations.description: The claim of '0.05% of hours in any given week' equals approximately 5 minutes of use per week (0.0005 Ã— 168 hours). This conflicts with stated 3-hour sessions and commercial operation plans. Such mathematical errors raise questions about the accuracy of other operational projections in the application.  Further, why should future use be patterned on present use?
